name: 3dZcat
author: AFNI Developers
description: Concatenates datasets in the slice (z) direction

inputs.description: Use 'pname' for the output dataset prefix name. [default='zcat']
inputs.name: Output Prefix

inputs.description: Coerce the output data to be stored as the given type, which may be byte, short, or float.
inputs.name: Output Datum

inputs.description: Force scaling of the output to the maximum integer range. This only has effect if the output datum is byte or short (either forced or defaulted). This option is sometimes necessary to eliminate unpleasant truncation artifacts.
inputs.name: Force Scaling

inputs.description: Don't do any scaling on output to byte or short datasets. This may be especially useful when operating on mask datasets whose output values are only 0's and 1's.
inputs.name: No Scaling

inputs.description: Print out some verbosity as the program proceeds.
inputs.name: Verbose

inputs.description: Be 'frugal' in the use of memory, at the cost of I/O time. Only needed if the program runs out of memory. Note frugality cannot be combined with NIFTI output
inputs.name: Frugal Memory Usage

output-files.description: AFNI HEAD file of the output dataset
output-files.name: Output HEAD File

output-files.description: AFNI BRIK file of the output dataset
output-files.name: Output BRIK File
